instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.U5000: What is U5000? This is the System Management Controller(SMC) in macbooks from 2013-2015.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.3V42_G3H: What is 3V42_G3H? This is shorthand for PP3V42_G3H which is one of the first power rails that must turn on in older Macbooks that use a magsafe charger in order for them to get a light on the charger. This power rail powers the onewire circuit and the SMC, which are necessary for the machine to communicate with the charger and get it to turn on, as well as begin the bootup sequence. .
definitions.R7121: What is R7121? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> WATER
threads.message:
hello
i have mainboard <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with problem after water damage
i have clean and laptop work 2 weeks
actually no boot, no light on charger

Problem is with <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>

i have 1.4V on F7140 pin1 after remove F4140 but i have good diode value (0.1)
but on pin 2 i have 0.4 in mode diode but need 0.1

i have check around <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> no water but i have replace it for be sure same problem

around <CHIP>U5000</CHIP>  no see damage components

please need your help

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> WATER
threads.message:
"but on pin 2 i have 0.4 in mode diode but need 0.1"
With F7140 removed???
STOP making wrong assumptions and put some logic on your job.
So simple like comparing with other board; in case you don't believe me!

You've changed <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> without checking its voltages?
Which value made you took such decision?

Do you get <SIGNAL>3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> at least?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> WATER
threads.message:
i have this group for help for repair
on  <SIGNAL>3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> i have 3.41V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> WATER
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> WATER
threads.message:
Pin 1: 0v
Pin 2 : 18v
Pin 3 : 4.9v
Pin 9 : 3.9v
Pin 12 : 3.41v
Pin 13 : 3.38v
Pin 14 : 3.37v
Pin 15 : 0v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> WATER
threads.message:
What about the rest???

Please use 45W charger; or set 15-16V on lab PSU, if use it.
4.9V on ACIN may be too high and <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> can stop to work; not sure, just in case.
Check if machine turns on in SMC bypass mode.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> WATER
threads.message:
with 15V on lab PSU :
Pin 1: 0v
Pin 2 : 14.2v
Pin 3 : 3.9v
Pin 9 : 3.9v
Pin 12 : 3.41v
Pin 13 : 3.38v
Pin 14 : 3.37v
Pin 15 : 0v 
pin 17 : 1.56v
pin 19 : 5v
pin 20 : 5v
pin 27 : 0v
